results.title: The Cars That Ate China
results.creator_credit: Jumping Dog Productions, Ard Norddeutscher Rundfunk, Stefan Moore, Susan Lambert and Frank Haines
results.brief_description:
China is in the midst of an automotive revolution that has not been witnessed since the halcyon days of Henry Ford. Cars are now the ultimate symbol of status and prosperity in a country that is well on its way to becoming the biggest economy in the world.
But car culture is also bringing about volatile class divisions, the world’s worst air pollution, and fierce global competition for limited resources. And it’s only just begun.
Today, car culture is everywhere - in television ads, glossy magazines, glitzy showrooms and international auto shows with scantily clad models. For China’s rising middle class, the new prosperity symbolised by the car is intoxicating. For the future of Chinese society, the environment and the world, some of the prospects are chilling.
The film is set in Beijing, once called the ‘Bicycle Kingdom’ and now the epicentre of China’s exploding car culture. The story is a poignant and surprising parable about a world that has profound repercussions for our own.

results.title: Fire of the Land
results.creator_credit: Valerie Bichard, Eliza Johnson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.

results.title: The Moment
results.creator_credit: Apid Busayasiri and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A young man goes to visit the grave of his grandmother at a remote graveyard on the outskirts of a city. While he is there a series of mysterious events unfold that magically transport him back to his joyful childhood. Hand drawn animation.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Helium
results.brief_description: Throughout the year, thousands of balloons are released as part of sporting events. But where do they end up? Go on an adventure as one such group of balloons band together to overcome the dangers of the world beyond the stadium.

results.title: The Shed
results.brief_description: ‘The Shed’ is a 2D hand-drawn animation. A humurous tale of an alien occupied spaceship that arrives on a farm on earth and offers his greetings. He finds an unhatched egg attractive and proceeds to leave earth with the egg.

results.title: La Maison des Cochons
results.creator_credit: Minty, Matt Tumbers and David Harris
results.brief_description: A claymation about an unsuspecting man whose fondness for baby pork is tantalised when he passes a restaurant that specialises in pig dishes. He is charmed and impressed by the service and ambience of the restaurant as he places his order with the waiter. The gruesome truth of the restaurant is soon revealed to the man when his dish arrives.

results.title: Be smart... don't start
results.brief_description: Especially designed for elementary grades at school, this film looks at cigarette smoking and the hazards of starting the habit. It presents opposing opinions and claims of cigarette manufacturers and medical men in an effort to create a lifetime mental attitude toward smoking at this critical age level.
